alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Western San Luis Obispo and Western Santa Barbara County. * WHEN...Until 530 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain across the area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inch per hour with local rates up to 0.75 inch per hours have been observed. Runoff will cause ponding on pavement surfaces and minor flooding of low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Lompoc, Santa Ynez, Point Conception, Nipomo, Solvang, Vandenberg Space Force Base, Jalama Beach, Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park, Refugio State Beach, El Capitan State Beach. - Minor flooding of creeks and streams is occurring west and northwest of Gaviota out to Jalama Beach and along Highway 1 between Las Cruces and Lompoc. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
